entities.description: "Timothy Niven is an author of the paper on neural network comprehension of natural language arguments."
"Hung-Yu Kao is an author of the paper on neural network comprehension of natural language arguments."
"Intelligent Knowledge Management Lab is the department where the research was conducted, part of the National Cheng Kung University."

entities.entity_name: "DEPARTMENT OF COMPUTER SCIENCE AND INFORMATION ENGINEERING"
entities.description: "Department of Computer Science and Information Engineering is the academic department associated with the research."
"National Cheng Kung University is the institution where the Intelligent Knowledge Management Lab is located."
"Tainan is the city where the National Cheng Kung University is located."
"The Argument Reasoning Comprehension Task is a task focused on inference within argumentation mining, which is central to the research paper."
"ARCT SemEval shared task is an event where the challenging nature of argument reasoning comprehension was verified."
"BERT is a model mentioned in the paper that achieved peak performance on the Argument Reasoning Comprehension Task."
"Mochales and Moens are referenced in the paper for their work on argumentation mining."
"Lippi and Torroni are referenced in the paper for their work on argumentation mining."
"Habernal et al. are referenced multiple times in the paper for their work on argument annotation and the ARCT."
"Toulmin is referenced in the paper for introducing the concept of warrants in argumentation."
"Walton is referenced in the paper for his work on warrants being mostly left implicit."
"Devlin et al. are referenced in the paper for their work on BERT and its performance on the Argument Reasoning Comprehension Task."
"Google is mentioned in the paper as an example of a search engine in the context of a monopoly argument."
"Argumentation mining is the task of determining argumentative structure in natural language text, which is the main focus of the paper."
"Warrants are a form of world knowledge that permit inferences and are central to the argumentation mining task discussed in the paper."
"Adversarial dataset is a dataset constructed to provide a more robust assessment of argument comprehension, as discussed in the paper."
"Claim refers to a statement in an argument that is supported or attacked by reasons."
"Reason refers to a statement in an argument that supports or attacks a claim."
"Alternative warrant is a distractor in the Argument Reasoning Comprehension Task, written to lead to the negation of the claim."

relationships.description: "Timothy Niven is associated with the Intelligent Knowledge Management Lab as one of the authors of the research paper."
"Hung-Yu Kao is associated with the Intelligent Knowledge Management Lab as one of the authors of the research paper."
"The Intelligent Knowledge Management Lab is a part of the National Cheng Kung University."
"National Cheng Kung University is located in Tainan."
"The Argument Reasoning Comprehension Task was the focus of the ARCT SemEval shared task."
"BERT is a model that achieved high performance on the Argument Reasoning Comprehension Task."
"Mochales and Moens contributed to the field of argumentation mining."
"Lippi and Torroni contributed to the field of argumentation mining."
"Habernal et al. are associated with the development and analysis of the Argument Reasoning Comprehension Task."
"Toulmin introduced the concept of warrants in argumentation."
"Walton contributed to the understanding of warrants being mostly left implicit."
"Devlin et al. are associated with the development of BERT."

entities.description: "BERT is a model used in experiments to evaluate the exploitation of spurious statistical cues in the ARCT dataset."
"ARCT is the event or dataset used for training and testing models, particularly focusing on the presence of statistical cues over labels."
"BoV is mentioned as one of the baselines in the probing experiments with BERT Large."
"BiLSTM is another baseline model used in the probing experiments with BERT Large."
"English is the language used in the dataset and by the native speaker who manually negated the remaining claims."
"The set of tokens in the warrant for data point $i$ with label $j$, used to define a cue's applicability."
"Cue's applicability, defined as the number of data points where a cue occurs with one label but not the other."
"Productivity of a cue, defined as the proportion of applicable data points for which it predicts the correct answer."
"Coverage of a cue, defined as the proportion of applicable cases over the total number of data points."
"Table showing the productivity and coverage of using the presence of 'not' in the warrant to predict the label in ARCT."
"Table presenting the results of probing experiments with BERT Large, and the BoV and BiLSTM baselines."
"Setup where models are trained only on the warrants, used to evaluate the exploitation of distributional cues over the labels."
"Setup where models consider cues in the reasons and warrants, used to evaluate model performance."
"Setup where models consider cues in the claims and warrants, used to evaluate model performance."
"A test set created by negating the claim and inverting the label for each data point to eliminate the problem of statistical cues over labels in ARCT."
"A figure illustrating the process of creating adversarial examples by negating the claim and inverting the label for each data point."
"Table presenting the results of models trained on adversarial training and validation sets, then evaluated on the adversarial test set."

relationships.description: "BERT is a model that is evaluated on the ARCT dataset to understand its performance in exploiting statistical cues."
"BoV is a baseline model used in probing experiments within the context of the ARCT dataset."
"BiLSTM is a baseline model used in probing experiments within the context of the ARCT dataset."
"BERT and BoV are compared in probing experiments to evaluate their performance on the ARCT dataset."
"BERT and BiLSTM are compared in probing experiments to evaluate their performance on the ARCT dataset."
"$\mathbb{T}_{j}^{(i)}$ is used to define the applicability $\alpha_{k}$ of a cue."
"$\alpha_{k}$ is used in the calculation of the productivity $\pi_{k}$ of a cue."
"$\alpha_{k}$ is used in the calculation of the coverage $\xi_{k}$ of a cue."
"Table 2 shows the productivity $\pi_{k}$ of using the presence of 'not' in the warrant to predict the label in ARCT."
"Table 2 shows the coverage $\xi_{k}$ of using the presence of 'not' in the warrant to predict the label in ARCT."
"Table 3 presents results for the setup W, where models are trained only on the warrants."

"ARCT is an event or task focused on machine argument comprehension, with the aim of evaluating machine learning models' performance."
"BERT is an organization or model known for its performance in natural language processing tasks, with a focus on its ability to comprehend arguments in the context of ARCT."
"Choi and Lee are researchers who have contributed to previous work on ARCT, utilizing transfer learning from Natural Language Inference datasets."
"Zhao et al. are researchers who have been involved in previous successful work on ARCT, also using transfer learning from NLI datasets."
"Niven and Kao are researchers who have conducted experiments related to ARCT, focusing on the classification of warrants and the impact of shared parameters on regularization against cue labels."

"Botschen et al. are researchers who added FrameNet knowledge to ARCT models, resulting in modest performance gains and potential standout performance due to the inclusion of required world knowledge."

"Glockner et al. are researchers who have worked on statistical cues in NLP, adding to the body of knowledge relevant to ARCT."

"Habernal et al. are researchers who reported experiments using the original ARCT training data, suggesting the problem's difficulty due to high similarity between data points."

relationships.description: "BERT's performance in ARCT has been evaluated, showing a significant drop in performance when spurious statistical cues are eliminated, indicating the importance of controlling for such cues in machine argument comprehension."
"Choi and Lee's previous work on ARCT involved transfer learning from NLI datasets, contributing to the understanding of machine argument comprehension."
"Zhao et al.'s previous work on ARCT also utilized transfer learning from NLI datasets, impacting the field of machine argument comprehension."

"Niven and Kao conducted experiments related to ARCT, focusing on the classification of warrants and the regularization against cue labels, influencing the understanding of machine argument comprehension."
"Botschen et al. added FrameNet knowledge to ARCT models, potentially standing out due to the inclusion of required world knowledge, affecting the performance in machine argument comprehension."

entities.description: "BERT is a model that has shown surprising performance in argument comprehension tasks, but its effectiveness can be attributed to exploiting spurious statistical cues."
"ARCT is a dataset used to evaluate argument comprehension, where models including BERT are tested for their performance."
"Devlin et al. are researchers who reported on BERT's performance on small datasets, noting that it sometimes fails to train, yielding degenerate results."
"Hugging Face PyTorch provides the implementation of BERT that is used in the experiments described in the text."
"GloVe is the provider of 300-dimensional embeddings trained on 640B tokens, used as inputs for BoV and BiLSTM models in the experiments."
"BoV, or Bag of Vectors, is a baseline model used in the experiments for argument comprehension tasks."
"BiLSTM, or Bidirectional LSTM, is a baseline model used in the experiments for argument comprehension tasks."
"GIST is the SemEval winning model, used as a baseline in the experiments for argument comprehension tasks."
"Botschen et al. are researchers whose best model is used as a baseline in the experiments for argument comprehension tasks."
"Choi and Lee are researchers associated with the GIST model, used as a baseline in the experiments for argument comprehension tasks."
"Hochreiter and Schmidhuber are researchers who introduced the BiLSTM model, used as a baseline in the experiments for argument comprehension tasks."
"Srivastava et al. are researchers associated with dropout regularization, a technique used in the experiments for argument comprehension tasks."
"Kingma and Ba are researchers associated with Adam optimization, a technique used in the experiments for argument comprehension tasks."
"Pennington et al. are researchers associated with GloVe embeddings, used as inputs for BoV and BiLSTM models in the experiments."
"Adam optimization is a method used for training models, as referenced in the context of hyperparameter selection and model training."
"Dropout regularization is a technique used to prevent overfitting in models, applied in the experiments described."
"Grid search is a method for hyperparameter optimization used in the experiments to find the best model settings."
"Softmax is a function used in the model to determine a probability distribution over the two warrants based on the logits."
"CLS vector refers to the final layer classification vector in BERT models, used to calculate logits for classification."
"Linear layer is a component in the model architecture that processes the CLS vector to obtain logits for classification."
"An argument-warrant pair is a component of the dataset used for training and evaluating models on argument comprehension tasks."
"Spurious statistical cues are unintended patterns in the data that models like BERT may exploit, leading to看似 impressive but ultimately unreliable performance."
"Linguistic artifacts refer to specific language features that may unevenly distribute across warrants, creating spurious statistical cues."
"Unigrams and bigrams are the basic linguistic units considered in the analysis of spurious statistical cues in the dataset."
"Hyperparameters are settings in a model that are not learned from the data but are selected before training, using techniques like grid search."
"Validation accuracy is a metric used to evaluate model performance during training, guiding decisions like learning rate annealing."
"Test set accuracy is a metric used to evaluate the final model performance on unseen data, indicating the model's generalization capability."
"Learning rate annealing is a technique where the learning rate is reduced when validation accuracy drops, to prevent overfitting."
"An epoch refers to a full pass through the training dataset, during which the model parameters are updated based on the learning algorithm."
"Random assignment is a method used to label the warrants in the dataset, ensuring an equal probability of being correct."
"A binary label is a type of label used in the dataset, indicating one of two possible outcomes or categories."
"Logits are the raw output values from the model before applying a softmax function to obtain probabilities for classification."
"Prediction refers to the final output of the model, which is the class with the highest probability as determined by the softmax function."
"Human performance is a benchmark used to compare the performance of models, representing the accuracy of human judgment on the task."

relationships.description: "BERT's performance is evaluated on the ARCT dataset, which is designed to test argument comprehension."
"BERT's implementation used in the experiments is provided by Hugging Face PyTorch."
"BoV is a baseline model used to evaluate performance on the ARCT dataset."
"BiLSTM is a baseline model used to evaluate performance on the ARCT dataset."
"GIST is a baseline model used to evaluate performance on the ARCT dataset."
"The model by Botschen et al. is a baseline used to evaluate performance on the ARCT dataset."
